column4: what puzzles me is that I don't have an NIC in the computer that's having a problem....
just a wlan card
so I don't undertand why I can ping my AP and can't get the internet
also make sure that your ap is set up for more than one ip at a time
the AP is set for more than one AP at a time.  presently, two other machines connect to it
in fact, the AP gave the troublesome box an IP
well it is an issue that caught me out, even 10 years after doing my first install using a floppy :)
although, curiously, when I looked through the AP's logs, it didn't log a hostname!
install of FLOSS that is
it's bizarre.
what ip has it got?
ummm....
what ip the box that is
the troublebox?
that would it
got it.  it's running at 192.168.0.102
no hostname (strange)
is that at me, and if so what am I supposed to do?
OK.
gotyou.
add default gw ROUTERIP--what's that supposed to do?
it helps the machine find the internet
